sourcing.instructions: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supply company, e.g., Sigma-Aldrich; Li: Purchase lithium carbonate from a chemical supplier; Pa: Purchase from a specialty materials vendor; Pr: Acquire from a chemical supply store; Te: Source from a materials supplier.
steps: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supply company, e.g., Sigma-Aldrich; Li: Purchase lithium carbonate from a chemical supplier; Pa: Purchase from a specialty materials vendor; Pr: Acquire from a chemical supply store; Te: Source from a materials supplier.

1. Weigh out 40.0 g of cesium (Cs), 10.0 g of lithium (Li), 5.0 g of protactinium (Pa), 5.0 g of praseodymium (Pr), and 150.0 g of tellurium (Te) using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry beaker, combine Cs and Li, stirring gently with a glass rod. 3. Gradually add Pa and Pr to the mixture, continuing to stir to ensure thorough mixing. 4. Finally, add Te to the mixture, ensuring an even distribution of the ingredients. 5. Transfer the mixture to a ceramic crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 40.0 g of cesium (Cs), 10.0 g of lithium (Li), 5.0 g of protactinium (Pa), 5.0 g of praseodymium (Pr), and 150.0 g of tellurium (Te) using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry beaker, combine Cs and Li, stirring gently with a glass rod. 3. Gradually add Pa and Pr to the mixture, continuing to stir to ensure thorough mixing. 4. Finally, add Te to the mixture, ensuring an even distribution of the ingredients. 5. Transfer the mixture to a ceramic crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the ceramic crucible containing the mixture into the furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to allow for complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the ceramic crucible containing the mixture into the furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to allow for complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace but leave the crucible inside to cool gradually. 2. Allow to cool for at least 4 hours until the temperature reaches room temperature.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace but leave the crucible inside to cool gradually. 2. Allow to cool for at least 4 hours until the temperature reaches room temperature.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out the edges and surface of the material to achieve the desired dimensions. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant for protection against environmental factors.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out the edges and surface of the material to achieve the desired dimensions. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant for protection against environmental factors.
